citHeader("To cite RRphylo implementations and auxilliary functions in publications use:")

bibentry(bibtype        = "Article",
         header       = "RRphylo package, search.shift, and auxilliary functions",
         title        = "A new method for testing evolutionary rate variation and shifts in phenotypic evolution.",
         author       = c(person("Silvia Castiglione"),
                                   person("Gianmarco Tesone"),
                                   person("Martina Piccolo"),
                                   person("Marina Melchionna"),
                                   person("Alessandro Mondanaro"),
                                   person("Carmela Serio"),
                                   person("Mirko Di Febbraro"),
                                   person("Pasquale Raia")),
         journal      = "Methods in Ecology and Evolution",
         year         = "2018",
         volume       = "9",
         pages        = "974-983",
         url          = "https://besjournals.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1111/2041-210X.12954",
         textVersion  = paste("Castiglione, S., Tesone, G., Piccolo, M., Melchionna, M., Mondanaro, A., Serio, C., Di                            Febbraro, M., & Raia, P.(2018).",
                        "A new method for testing evolutionary rate variation and shifts in phenotypic evolution.",
                        "Methods in Ecology and Evolution, 9: 974-983.",
                        "doi:10.1111/2041-210X.12954")
)

bibentry(bibtype        = "Article",
         header       = "tree.merger",
         title        = "Fast Production of Large, Time-Calibrated Informal Supertrees with tree.merger",
         author       = c(person("Silvia Castiglione"),
                                   person("Carmela Serio"),
                                   person("Alessandro Mondanaro"),
                                   person("Marina Melchionna"),
                                   person("Pasquale Raia")),
         journal      = "Palaeontology",
         year         = "2022",
         volume       = "65",
         pages        = "e12588",
         url          = "https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/pala.12588",
         textVersion  = paste("Castiglione, S., Serio, C., Mondanaro, A., Melchionna, M., & Raia, P.(2022).",
                        "Fast Production of Large, Time-Calibrated Informal Supertrees with tree.merger.",
                        "Palaeontology, 65, e12588.",
                        "doi:10.1111/pala.12588")
)

The goal of RRphylo is to compute phenotypic evolutionary rates,
estimate ancestral states, locate rate shifts on the tree, and compare
vectors of phenotypes and evolutionary rates among species. RRphylo is
not based on any evolutionary model, and is best suited to work with
phylogenies of fossil species.

You can install the released version of RRphylo from
[CRAN](https://CRAN.R-project.org) with:

``` r
install.packages("RRphylo")
```

You can install RRphylo from github by using the R package devtools:

``` r
install.packages("devtools")

devtools::install_github("pasraia/RRphylo",build_vignettes = TRUE,dependencies=TRUE)
```
